item.title: On simulation
item.description:
This is mostly a draft to test this blog generator

The concept and practice of simulating things pops up frequently in programming.

Perhaps it’s a computer’s main function is to simulate something.

What does it mean to simulate?

Conway’s game of life can simulate a Turing machine

What is being simulated?

There are countless examples.

Text editors simulate a typewriter with interactive editing. A 3d world, a 2d world, a “desktop”.

What CPUs actually do

“copy, compare, calculate.”

All operations boil down to: - copying data from one location to another location - comparing two numbers and doing something different based on the result - operations on numbers (integers, floating points)
